intro: Sagraea hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy sagraea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Sagraea hirsuta is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique appearance.
